entries.prompt: An agency is brokering loans from two different credit institutes. A customer fills out a loan request con-taining the requested amount and his current monthly income. Afterwards he gets the loan proposal with the lowest interest returned. Each financial institution has different rules for assigning loans. Bank A assigns loans to everyone up to 20 times the month income but wants 20% interest a year. Bank B as-signs loans to everyone with at least 2.000‚Ç¨ month income up to 100.000‚Ç¨. Loans equal or under 25.000‚Ç¨ are pre-checked by an external credit rating company (e.g. SCHUFA in Germany). Loans above 25.000‚Ç¨ additionally require a security which has to be checked directly with the customer. The interest rates are 15% for loans under 25.000‚Ç¨, 12.5% for loans above 25.000‚Ç¨ with an adequate security, and 22.5% for loans without an adequate security.

Follow these rules:

1. Pools represent separate independent organizations. Lanes are departments or participants within a pool. 
2. Use send and receive message events to communicate between pools only and not lanes.
Example Input: "Customer sends a request to a company".

3. Use send and receive message events as one-to-one. Use exclusive gateways to choose one path based on a condition. Use event-based gateways to choose a path based on incoming events.
Example Input:  "Company prepares and sends an offer to Customer, who decides to accept or reject it. If no response is received within 10 days, the Company initiates a follow-up action".
